thread.title: Weekend Game Plan: 7 cool things to do in Tuscaloosa including Alabama homecoming
thread.title_full: Weekend Game Plan: 7 cool things to do in Tuscaloosa including Alabama homecoming

author: Ben Flanagan | bflanagan@al.com
title: Weekend Game Plan: 7 cool things to do in Tuscaloosa including Alabama homecoming
text:
TUSCALOOSA, Alabama -- Here's what's shaking in Tuscaloosa this weekend. 
University of Alabama homecoming festivities Friday and Saturday, Oct. 9-10 University of Alabama, 711 Capstone Drive Enjoy the pep rally, bonfire, queen crowning, lawn decorations, parade and football game with a full weekend of activities and tradition happening in Tuscaloosa. Learn about the full schedule here for fun the whole family can enjoy as the Crimson Tide takes on Arkansas in Bryant-Denny on Saturday at 6 p.m. 
Alabama at Tuscaloosa Amphitheater Friday, Oct. 9, 8 p.m. Tuscaloosa Amphitheater, 2710 Jack Warner Parkway Fans will get a warm-up on "Dixieland Delight" this fall, as country legends Alabama will perform at Tuscaloosa's premiere music venue. The Grammy-winning band is currently comprised of Randy Owen, Teddy Gentry and Jeff Cook. You can purchase tickets online via Ticketmaster, by phone at (800) 745-3000 or at the Tuscaloosa Amphitheater box office. 
Robert Earl Keen at Druid City Music Hall Friday, Oct. 9, 9:30 p.m. Druid City Music Hall, 1307 University Boulevard, Tuscaloosa The Texas-born country, folk and Americana star will perform at the city's newest music venue on Friday night, helping to kick off homecoming festivities on the Strip. Learn about tickets at the Druid City Music Hall website . 
Live music at Green Bar Friday and Saturday, Oct. 9-10 Green Bar, 2209 4th Street, Tuscaloosa Enjoy some fantastic local and regional music at one of Tuscaloosa's best venues with Organic Androids and Fraug on Friday night starting in the neighborhood of 8 p.m. followed by Manchino and The Black Water Thieves starting around 10:30 p.m. on Saturday. 
Tuscaloosa Farmers Market Saturday, Oct. 10, 7 a.m. until noon Tuscaloosa River Market, 1900 Jack Warner Parkway Located on the banks of the Black Warrior River, the Tuscaloosa River Market has a farmers market every Saturday morning from 7 a.m, until noon. Learn more at www.tuscaloosarivermarket.com . 
Alabama vs. Arkansas in Bryant-Denny Stadium Saturday, Oct. 10, 6 p.m. Bryant-Denny Stadium, 920 Paul W Bryant Drive The Crimson Tide gained a ton of momentum with its road win against the Georgia Bulldogs in Athens last weekend. They look to keep the hot streak going against the Arkansas Razorbacks in Bryant-Denny Stadium on Saturday at 6 p.m. Can the Nick Saban and the Tide keep their College Football Playoff hopes alive against the talented Razorbacks? Bama struggled on the road against Bret Bielema's team last year, but look to rebound in 2015. 
Movies! Check Fandango for times and prices The fall movie season rolls with the release of director Joe Wright's fantasy "Pan," a re-telling of J.M. Barrie's classic Peter Pan story, or at least the origin, starring Hugh Jackman, Rooney Mara, Garrett Hedlund and Levi Miller. There's also the R-rated stop-motion animated movie "Hell & Back," starring Nick Swardson, Mila Kunis, Bob Odenkirk and others. 
Follow Ben Flanagan on Twitter. Email at bflanagan@al.com .
